channel.title: Midi IN is not working
channel.description:
Hi all, I have been reading you for long time but it is my first post. I am writing you because Midi IN has stop to work.
I have test it with a simple patch in live, linking IN and OUT.
Could you confirm that this patch is enough to test it? If it is brocken, bould be enough to replace the octocoupler?
Thanks
Patch Capture: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GCW7w92Tq11qJmXWeiUyBpceL2KBtfV-/view?usp=sharing

item.title: Midi IN is not working
item.dc:creator: @oozora Ōzora
item.description:
@oozora wrote:

Thank you!

With your test I can see that data is received.
But that's not the case when I connect a controller.
There is something weird.
I will try to get an other controller for testing it.

Cheers

Read full topic

item.title: Midi IN is not working
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

Yeah that patch will send out a value on cc 0, on channel one. You should be able to receive it in any midi device connected to the midi din, And you also set up the correct midi port so all that is okay. If you wan to avoid havinh to push the button, to send the value.

For testing try this:

The low object will show any midi input.

Read full topic
